O that I had in the desert
that I might leave my people
For they are all adulterers,
They bend their tongues like bows;
for they proceed from evil to evil,
Who is wise enough to understand this? To whom has the mouth of the  spoken, so that they may declare it? Why is the land ruined and laid waste like a wilderness, so that no one passes through?
And the  says: Because they have forsaken my law that I set before them, and have not obeyed my voice, or walked in accordance with it,
but have stubbornly followed their own hearts and have gone after the Baals, as their ancestors taught them.
Therefore thus says the  of hosts, the God of Israel: I am feeding this people with wormwood, and giving them poisonous water to drink.
I will scatter them among nations that neither they nor their ancestors have known; and I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.
The People Mourn in Judgment
Thus says the  of hosts:
Consider, and call for the mourning women to come;
let them quickly raise a dirge over us,
For a sound of wailing is heard from Zion:
because we have left the land,
Thus says the : Do not let the wise boast in their wisdom, do not let the mighty boast in their might, do not let the wealthy boast in their wealth;
but let those who boast boast in this, that they understand and know me, that I am the ; I act with steadfast love, justice, and righteousness in the earth, for in these things I delight, says the .
The days are surely coming, says the , when I will attend to all those who are circumcised only in the foreskin:
Egypt, Judah, Edom, the Ammonites, Moab, and all those with shaven temples who live in the desert. For all these nations are uncircumcised, and all the house of Israel is uncircumcised in heart.
